message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS 

The paper discusses information filtering applications, which are commonly studied in the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. The use of rule-based filters and the need for maintaining their performance is also relevant to the Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) and Machine Learning (cs.LG, cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the method proposed in the paper involves a learning-based control filter, which falls under the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
